thread.title: md5 exporter doesn't export softbody mesh (animated cloth)

post.author: motorsep
post.body:
I thought der_ton's md5 exporter for Blender exports everything to md5.. Like his general md5 exporter for MAX.
But yesterday I was exporting a character who has cloth (that is mesh animated with softbody dynamics) and I end up not having that mesh at all in my final md5 files.
What's the problem? Where to dig? How to solve it?
Thanks in advance.

post.author: kit89
post.body: Soft bodies to my knowledge are not supported by any game engine.

post.author: kat
post.body: Yes it won't export that unless you have bones associated with the movement, they're the things that the exporter and game 'locks' on to. I don't think we have a general exporter for Blender otherwise it'd proably work by adding a bone for each vertex (which ends up being a lot!).

post.author: der_ton
post.body: Yes there is no general md5 exporter for blender. Technically it should be possible to write one that works just like the one for 3dsmax (generating a bone for every animated vertex), but I haven't given it much thought yet. Somebody else was also thinking about writing this for blender, I don't recall who it was, it was mentioned in a thread roughly about a year ago.

post.author: motorsep
post.body: ic.. I guess I am gonna have to forget about softbody dynamics

post.author: Super Happy Cow
post.body: Is it possible to apply ragdoll physics to a living character?

post.author: der_ton
post.body: No, the ragdoll physics are applied only after death.
